node.title: The same places keep appearing in most-disadvantaged lists. COVID means it could be getting worse
node.alt: Chandelle Wilson leaning over a table covered in pantry foods like vegemite and sauce, filling bags for Foodbank.
node.description: The most comprehensive report into disadvantage in Australia reveals disadvantage is not only entrenched in some communities, it also impacts a wide range of factors.
node.content:
["As she fills up baskets at the local Foodbank, volunteer Chandelle Wilson identifies with the attitudes of those coming in for help.", "\"There is a whole background of [being]\u00a0downtrodden,\" she said.", "\"Of not believing that you deserve more because this is where you're from.\"", "Ms\u00a0Wilson has spent her life in Western Sydney. She now lives in Blackett, an area that repeatedly ranks as one of the most disadvantaged in New South Wales.", "She believes many people in the community have struggled for so long they've given up long-term thinking.", "\"[They're]\u00a0literally limping along in survival mode. What do we need to get us through?\" she said.", "\"Just getting by is top of mind.\"", "", "
Chandelle Wilson (right) has spent her life in Western Sydney.(ABC News: Brendan Esposito)
", "The 41-year-old mother of two is a community worker and a volunteer. She's lived in public housing, started and lost a business, and has overcome childhood trauma.", "Her work at the Foodbank is motivated by the meals she sees in front of many families in the community, including her own.\u00a0", "\"They don't have the education to be able to understand what's healthy, what's not,\" she said.", "\"And we wonder why areas like this have health problems long term.\"", "", "
Chandelle Wilson said food can be seen as comfort or a reward, rather than nourishment.(ABC News: Brendan Esposito)
", "In the most comprehensive report into disadvantage in Australia from Jesuit Social Services, Ms\u00a0Wilson's community Blackett fares poorly on a number of indicators, including health.", "The report, Dropping off the Edge 2021, was compiled by experts and researchers at the University of Canberra.", "It measures disadvantage across a range of areas in each state and territory. It expands on the number of indicators from reports in 2007 and 2015, with the inclusion of environmental and intergenerational factors.", "Everything from heat stress to teenage pregnancy, to children living in households with jobless parents,\u00a0was measured for every community in Australia.", "\"What it shows really clearly is there's a small number of communities around the country that are experiencing disadvantage in a number of different issues,\" Andrew Yule from Jesuit Social Services said.", "\"It's things like housing, education, employment and even environment as well.\"", "Once communities appear on the list of the most disadvantaged, Andrew Yule said they tended to stay there.", "\"We know that when you've got high levels of disadvantage across a number of different issues \u2014\u00a0that can be really hard to shift.\"", "
COVID has likely deepened inequality
", "In four states and the ACT, the most likely indicator of disadvantage was the percentage of people in a community living in households with a family income of less than $650 per week.", "The percentage of early school leavers, the rate of family violence, and the prevalence of people in unskilled occupations were also common influential indicators.", "The report used data from states and territories gathered up to 2019, and it analysed material from the 2016 census.", "", "
Professor Treloar believes COVID has only exacerbated disadvantage in communities.(ABC News: Niall Lenihan)
", "That means these numbers don't take into account the impact of COVID. And when it comes to disadvantage, Professor Carla Treloar from the University of New South Wales believes that has only made things worse.", "\"We're expecting that COVID has deepened these patterns of poverty and inequality and make these groups even more vulnerable,\" Professor Treloar said.", "\"The highest numbers of people seeking income support were in areas that were previously disadvantaged prior to COVID.", "\"So we are concerned about an unequal bounce back post-COVID and an unequal economic recovery across very vulnerable groups.\"", "As in previous reports, Dropping off the Edge reveals disadvantage is not only entrenched in some communities, it also impacts a wide range of factors.", "In regional\u00a0Victoria, it's something Belinda Gordon understands well.", "", "
Emilio and Belinda struggle to access healthcare in Shepparton.(ABC News: Scott Jewell)
", "The 42-year-old and her eight-year-old son Emilio live with a number of health issues and disabilities.", "The Shepparton mother lives with depression and chronic back pain. And she's concerned about Emilio, who experiences anxiety from past trauma. But getting help from a specialist is an ongoing challenge.", "\"There's a lack of paediatricians. There's a lack of specialists to actually diagnose children. There's just a lack of support in general,\" Ms Gordon said.", "About 200 kilometres north of Melbourne,\u00a0scores badly when it comes to access to health services. Compared with the rest of Victoria, it's among\u00a0the worst when it comes to the number of doctors per 1,000 people.", "Ms\u00a0Gordon has struggled to get Emilio the care he needs.", "\"It's just very hard to get someone to diagnose a child with anything, let alone mental health. A lot of the time we've got to go down to Melbourne,\" she said.", "\"But that's going to cost me $1,500 \u2026 I'm on a pension. I don't get a lot of money.\"", "Shepparton also scores poorly on new environmental factors measured to indicate disadvantage. It's among\u00a0the worst communities in Victoria when it comes to experiencing heat stress.", "\"It does get very, very hot out here. Some places you can get out, but there's a lack of shade,\" Ms\u00a0Gordon said.", "\"I don't go anywhere in summer. I pretty much stay home with the kids.\"", "
An 'entrenchment of disadvantage'
", "The stigma of being labelled a disadvantaged community is powerful.", "He came to Australia from Turkey three years ago, and yet it's something Berat Kaya already knows.", "", "
Berat Kaya said people in Broadmeadows felt forgotten by the government.(ABC News: Simon Tucci)
", "He lives in Broadmeadows in Melbourne, one of the most disadvantaged areas in Victoria across a number of indicators.", "\"I'm feeling bad, definitely. Because everybody [deserves to live]\u00a0in good conditions, clean conditions. But once you come to north side, it's not [as]\u00a0clean as the other sides,\" he said.", "\"If we look at more rich and educated suburbs than Broadmeadows, we can see many differences.\"", "Broadmeadows has consistently ranked as one of the most disadvantaged areas in Victoria in previous JSS reports.", "\"People [are]\u00a0already experiencing low income issues around this area. So I believe that's why people [think]\u00a0that government forgot [them],\" Mr\u00a0Kaya said.", "In report after report, the same areas appear on list of the most disadvantaged communities. Professor Treloar believes government policy could change that.", "\"Over 20 years, the rate of income support for people out of work hasn't shifted until this year. People who have to rely on that income support over the long period fall behind,\" Professor\u00a0Treloar said.", "\"So we see this entrenchment of disadvantage \u2026 we need local solutions, but that are underpinned by strong policy about increasing the rate of income support for people who find themselves out of work.\"", "", "
Belinda Gordon doesn't go out in summer due to heat stress.(ABC News: Scott Jewell)
", "In Shepparton, Belinda Gordon hopes things can change. But she's not optimistic.", "\"No one wants to listen to us. People think \u2026 they know what's best for this area, but unfortunately they don't,\" she said.", "\"They need to listen and really listen. Not just pretend to listen. It's only going to get worse.\""]
